data.title: [Editor] - Add developer menu item to open log file location
[Editor] Scene widget for switching ortho views

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
There are currently shortcuts for different orthographic views in the editor, having a widget in the scene view to toggle them would be good. Related to that would be a visible toggle for the grid.

Probably related to https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/issues/779

data.title: [C#/Windows] Consistent AtomicNET.dll referencing regardless of Editor build
data.body:
Currently, an editor built from source on Windows (CMake_VS2015.bat, followed by building Atomic.sln), when generating an AtomicNET solution for a C# project will:
-Generate AtomicNET.* source projects into the project
-Generate AtomicProject.* projects, including AtomicProject.Desktop which has a dependency on AtomicNET.Desktop and will output artifacts to a /Debug directory, including the AtomicNET.dll generated by AtomicNET.Desktop
-Generate a solution with both projects

A distributable editor built with Build_AtomicEditor.bat on the other hand will:
-Generate AtomicProject.* projects, including AtomicProject,Desktop, with a dependency on a precompiled AtomicNET.dll in the editor install location, using an absolute path and will output artifacts to a /Release directory, including the referenced AtomicNET.dll
-Generate a solution with just these projects

This inconsistency makes moving between editor builds problematic, and also makes it impossible to have external projects that reliably reference the same AtomicNET.dll as AtomicProject.*, complicating commandline build processes.

To solve this I'd like to suggest the following:
For an editor build from source:
-Still generate AtomicNET.* source projects into the project, but have them output to a consistent location such as AtomicNET/Lib, regardless of build configuration (Debug/Release)
-Have generated AtomicProject.Desktop project reference the dll in AtomicNET/Lib, instead of directly referencing the project, but set AtomicNET.Desktop as a build dependency
-Still generate a solution with all projects

For a distributable editor:
-When generating AtomicNET projects, copy AtomicNET.dll to AtomicNET/Lib within the project
-Have generated AtomicProject.Desktop project reference the dll in AtomicNET/Lib, instead of directly referencing the the dll in the editor install location
-Still generate a solution with just AtomicProject.* projects

data.title: [Editor] - Support inspector fields for nodes/prefabs
data.body: It should be possible to expose node fields (by id) and prefab selection (resource path) for drag/drop operations in editor

data.title: [C#/macOS/Linux] - When building Atomic and xbuild can't be found provide warning
data.body: The warning should be at the beginning and end of compile, basically we disable AtomicNET when doing a build without xbuild being available

data.body:
Successful install of Atomic on Kubuntu, but trying to run it results in this error:

`christoffer@christoffer-XPS-15-9550:~/Desktop/AtomicGameEngine/Artifacts/AtomicEditor$ ./AtomicEditor

data.title: Fix metrics
Num pass/single pass primitive metrics for Direct3D9
Get AtomicTool (net compile) running outside of the build tree, for example on a CI box
data.body: This PR cleans up ToolEnvironment initialization and makes it possible to running AtomicTool (including the net compile command) outside of the build tree

data.title: Copy libAtomicPlayer.so to build dir
data.body: The --with-android task correctly builds the libAtomicPlayer.so, and it copies it into AtomicEditor.app/Contents/Resources/ToolData/Deployment/Android/libs/armeabi-v7a, for managed C# deployment. This leaves the in-editor Build Android option unable to create an apk, as Dirk found in a Q&A entry.  This additional copy will restore the editor Build android functionality.

data.title: Adding current fps to engine subsystem
graphics FPS api
data.body:
This pr adds a graphics frames per second api to Atomic.
The api is:   float Graphics::GetGraphicsFps() for C++,
                    Atomic.graphics.getGraphicsFps()  for JS

data.title: Hooking in C++ feature examples
Automatically change class name in a Component

milestone.title: Issue Staging
milestone.description: A staging area for milestones, while we work through the backlog

data.body:
Right now, when making a new Component, the public class is called "Component" - this should be changed to the name of the file instead.

Edit: Once this is done, the this tutorial should be updated to not have "Component" in code examples and remove the bit about renaming: https://github.com/AtomicGameEngine/AtomicGameEngine/wiki/Basic-Scripting-in-CSharp

data.title: Adding AtomicExamples as a submodule, improved handling of not having submodules initialized
[Linux/OSX] Add zombie detection to IPC subsystem
data.body: When `prctl(PR_SET_PDEATHSIG, SIGHUP);`` is called in the child process, it will exit when the parent thread spawning the child process exits.  We should setup a signal handler in the IPC subsystem to handle this in the child process, in the case that we do not get an exit request.   There should be a short time delta to give the exit request a chance to come in.  If it doesn't, the child process should gracefully exit by exiting the engine subsystem.

data.title: Adding IPC::Shutdown for cleaning up and closing child processes
data.body: Closes #1125

data.title: fix linux child processes not dying
data.body:
This is to fix the AtomicNETService.exe not stopping when the AtomicEditor is closed #1125 
Using the StackOverflow most popular answer, it appears to work without (bad) side effects.

data.title: [Linux]  AtomicEditor leaves running process AtomicNETService.exe
data.body:
When you start the AtomicEditor, a mono + AtomicNETService.exe is also started, this is expected. On linux, when you close the editor, the AtomicNETService.exe is not stopped, so they hang around. Subsequent AtomicEditors start another AtomicNETService.exe and so on. 
OSX and Windows do not appear to have this problem. Im hoping @CTrauma can test this on linux distros other than Mint, to see how big the problem really is. 
   In diagnosing the problem, I'm finding that AtomicNETService.exe process is never told to send the event to engine it is running, to exit. It has a case in it's command loop to do this. Perhaps the process that is suppose to send this dies quicker on linux than other platforms, or they are suppose to be stopped some other way.

data.title: AtomicNET Subsystem cleanups
Build command autologging, file stream wrapper, ResourceCache.Scan
[C#] Register additonal subsystems for managed player, evaluate lazy registration
data.body:
There are some subsystems which aren't currently being registered, register them at startup

Also, evaluate lazy registration of subsystems as they are requested

data.title: Handle debugging of deployed managed apps
Fix for space in argument, when argument is already quoted
IPCPlayer CoreData access issue when space is in path
data.body: In order to reproduce on macOS, rename AtomicEditor.app to AtomicEditor 1.app (with a space), open a C# project and hit play.  Windows probably has the same issue, needs testing.

data.title: [C#] Improve messaging on Visual Studio/Xamarin Studio requirement
data.body:
When creating/opening a project with C# selected, a dialog box is opened with VS/XS requirement if these aren't installed.  

In this case, we shouldn't close the create project window and it should be made clear that JS/TS are available without using C# or installing VS/XS

data.title: webgl upgrade
data.body:
This allows for a more refined WebGL experience, with some different themes for the web page, an icon and the ability to change the game frame size. I was trying to make the game iframe responsive, but ran into possible cross domain complications, so fell back to setting the width and height.
I also whacked the splash screen icons, since they are not implemented.

data.title: [Rendering] Terrain is disappearing if rendered without any other models in view
data.body: To test make a terrain and add a model, position camera so clips model and terrain disappears as well

data.title: Adding support for unsigned short to C# bindings
data.body: Closes #1073
